alert.note: Alert for Fleming (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Fleming County through 530 PM EDT... At 500 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cowan, or 11 miles west of Flemingsburg, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fairview and Cowan around 505 PM EDT. Nepton and Elizaville around 510 PM EDT. Craintown around 515 PM EDT. Flemingsburg around 520 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Mount Carmel and Foxport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
